episode_summary: This episode of "No Such Thing As A Fish" features discussions on medieval jobs like municipal swine herds, the reliance of comedian Bob Hope on writers for his jokes, the regenerative abilities of stick insects, and a surprising lack of anatomical knowledge among Britons.

facts.fact: There was a job in medieval times called the municipal swine herd who was effectively a professional pig walker for city dwellers who didn't want to walk their own pigs.
The comedian Bob Hope was so reliant on his writers to come up with jokes for him, he even had them provide bespoke one-liners for his social life.
The unarmed stick insect has an infinite number of arms.
45% of Britons do not know where their rectum is.
